content:
| Stage | Step of the Attack | Technical Controls | CSF NIST Failed Controls |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Anonymizing services (TOR, VPN) usage | Monitor and block anonymized traffic, IP reputation management | PR.AC-4, PR.IP-3, PR.AT-1, DE.CM-7, DE.CM-8 |
| 2 | SSRF attack & access to private server | Implement proper input validation, SSRF vulnerability patching | PR.IP-3, PR.IP-6, PR.DS-1, PR.DS-2, PR.DS-5 |
| 3 | WAF misconfiguration | Regular WAF reviews, proper configuration management | PR.AC-1, PR.AC-5, PR.IP-1, PR.IP-2, PR.PT-3 |
| 4 | Obtain temporary credentials | Restrict IAM roles, enforce least privilege principle | PR.AC-4, PR.AC-6, PR.PT-1, PR.PT-4, PR.MA-1 |
| 5 | Listing all S3 Buckets | Implement access control policies, bucket-level encryption | PR.AC-1, PR.DS-2, PR.DS-4, PR.DS-5, PR.MA-1 |
| 6 | Data exfiltration from S3 buckets | Enable data loss prevention, monitor for unusual data transfers | DE.CM-2, DE.CM-7, DE.CM-8, DE.DP-1, DE.DP-4 |
